page.title: 12EDUCATION
page.content: OUR SCHOOL - ALEX SMITH AGED 10 Our school is made of red-brick and is in two stories. Classrooms are quite large. There are ten rooms but some are used for storage and resources. At 9.55 the whistle goes and we go to our classrooms. I get my book from my locker. Assembly comes next which is often a story. Classwork is varied. We may read for pleasure or do some practical work. At present we are exploring the world of plants and testing some seeds for iodine. At playtime we either go out on the playground or field. At lunchtime I have a packed lunch. Some pupils have a school dinner or go home. This is a poem I know about school dinners:- "If you have school dinners, you'd better chuck them aside. Some kids didn't. Some kids died!!!"
